text: Chickasaw Plaza is a plaza along the Bricktown Canal in Bricktown, Oklahoma City, in the U.S. state of Oklahoma. The plaza features a statue of a Chickasaw warrior, which was sponsored by the Chickasaw Nation, as well as markers describing the tribe's history and land loss following the Indian Removal Act and Trail of Tears. ==See also== * List of public art in Oklahoma City ==References== ==External links== * Category:Bricktown, Oklahoma City Category:Chickasaw
title: Chickasaw Plaza
